text: Blessed are the peacemakers, for they will be called children of God.
original: μακάριοι οἱ εἰρηνοποιοί, ὅτι αὐτοὶ υἱοὶ θεοῦ κληθήσονται.
transliteration: makarioi hoi eirēnopoioi, hoti autoi huioi theou klēthēsontai
context: Part of the Beatitudes from the Sermon on the Mount

text: For God so loved the world that he gave his one and only Son, that whoever believes in him shall not perish but have eternal life.
original: Οὕτως γὰρ ἠγάπησεν ὁ θεὸς τὸν κόσμον, ὥστε τὸν υἱὸν τὸν μονογενῆ ἔδωκεν, ἵνα πᾶς ὁ πιστεύων εἰς αὐτὸν μὴ ἀπόληται ἀλλ᾽ ἔχῃ ζωὴν αἰώνιον.
transliteration: houtōs gar ēgapēsen ho theos ton kosmon, hōste ton huion ton monogenē edōken, hina pas ho pisteuōn eis auton mē apolētai all᾽ echē zōēn aiōnion
context: Jesus explaining God's love and the purpose of his mission

text: In the beginning God created the heavens and the earth.
original: בְּרֵאשִׁית בָּרָא אֱלֹהִים אֵת הַשָּׁמַיִם וְאֵת הָאָרֶץ׃
transliteration: bereshit bara elohim et hashamayim ve'et ha'aretz
context: The opening verse of the Bible describing creation

text: The Lord is my shepherd, I lack nothing.
original: מִזְמוֹר לְדָוִד יְהוָה רֹעִי לֹא אֶחְסָר׃
transliteration: mizmor ledavid adonai ro'i lo echsar
context: The beginning of Psalm 23, a famous psalm of trust in God
